Package game

Class SaveLoad

java.lang.Object
game.SaveLoad
public class SaveLoad extends Object
This class contains methods to save and load games. Games are saved in a "saves" folder within the main game folder. This folder will be created if it does not already exist. Save files are named "saveX.sav" where X is replaced with the number of the saved game.

  • Method Details

    • getSaves

      public static String[] getSaves()
      Returns an array containing the names of all save files. Assumes save files have a ".sav" extension and are stored in the "saves" folder.
      Returns:
      names of save files

    • getOption

      public static int getOption(String s, int min, int max, String title) throws game.CancelledInputException
      Prompts the player to enter an integer option and returns that integer. Method verifies that integer entered is between min and max values, inclusive. Assumes min <= max.
      Parameters:
      s - prompt to display
      min - minimum available option
      max - maximum available option
      title - title of dialog box (for GUI applications)
      Returns:
      option entered by player
      Throws:
      game.CancelledInputException - if player selects "Cancel"

    • saveGame

      public static void saveGame()
      Saves the current game by creating or updating a save file.

    • saveGame

      public static void saveGame(int fileID)
      Saves the current game in a file named "saveX.sav" where X is the given fileID.
      Parameters:
      fileID - number of save file

    • loadGame

      public static void loadGame()
      Loads a game from a save file.

    • loadGame

      public static void loadGame(int fileID)
      Loads the save filed named "saveX.sav" where X is the given fileID.
      Parameters:
      fileID - number of save file
